lessons.title: Welcome to PY101
masteryOutcomes: Understand the course main topics and grading

lessons.title: Writing your first program
masteryOutcomes: Write and execute a simple Python script using the print() function

lessons.title: Unlocking print() power-ups
masteryOutcomes: Print multiple values using commas
Understand that printing is always in a new line
Print multiple text and numeric values using the + and * operators.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Café welcome board
masteryOutcomes: Reinforce using print() to display text and simple patterns, including multiple values and operators, to create a friendly café welcome screen.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Introduction to variables
masteryOutcomes: Explain that a variable is a named placeholder for a value in memory.
Write a valid variable name following Python conventions.
Assign a value (e.g., a number or a piece of text) to a variable using the = operator.
Use the print() function to display the value stored in a variable.

lessons.title: Working with text
masteryOutcomes: Define a "data type" as a category of data that determines what you can do with it.
Create a string variable by enclosing text in single (') or double (") quotes.
Combine two strings using the + operator (concatenation).
Predict the output when printing string variables.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Player profile card
masteryOutcomes: Practice creating and printing well-named variables and string data to display a simple player profile using concatenation.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Mini status updater
masteryOutcomes: Strengthen understanding of string variables and concatenation by building short status messages from multiple text parts and predicting their printed output.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Working with numbers
masteryOutcomes: Distinguish between an integer (int, a whole number) and a float (float, a number with a decimal).
Create variables to store integer and float values.
Perform basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /) on numeric variables.
Explain why 5 is different from "5".

lessons.title: Modeling real-world calculations
masteryOutcomes: Translate a two-step word problem into an arithmetic expression and compute the result.
Do arithmetic directly inside print() to produce clear, useful outputs.
Compare two equivalent formulations and choose the clearer one.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Snack bar checkout - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Apply integer and float variables with basic arithmetic operations to calculate item costs and totals for a snack bar order.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Snack bar checkout - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Translate short word problems into arithmetic expressions inside print() to compute and clearly display multi-step snack bar totals.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Review: writing your first program
masteryOutcomes: New mastery outcome

lessons.title: Division modes: / vs // with quotient and remainder
masteryOutcomes: Compute and contrast true division (/) and floor division (//) on integers
explain the difference.
Use // and % together to derive quotient and remainder for practical cases (e.g., packing/scheduling).

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Bus seating planner - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Use / and // to compare true division and floor division when planning how many buses are needed for groups of passengers.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Bus seating planner - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Combine // and % to compute quotient and remainder in realistic packing and scheduling scenarios and print clear summaries.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Checking the facts
masteryOutcomes: Use type() to check a variable's data type
Use the str(), int(), and float() functions to convert values between data types.

lessons.title: Talking to your program: getting input from users
masteryOutcomes: Explain why programs interact with users and when input() is appropriate
collect input with clear prompts.
Convert numeric inputs to the correct type before computing and print a friendly summary.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Café order helper
masteryOutcomes: Practice checking and converting data types while collecting user input to calculate and summarize a café order.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Mini trip cost calculator
masteryOutcomes: Collect user input with clear prompts, convert numeric values correctly, and compute and display a friendly trip cost summary.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Python errors: meet the traceback
masteryOutcomes: Understand why Python provides a traceback and how it helps identify what went wrong
Identify parts of a traceback and different types of tracebacks

lessons.title: Challenge: core foundations
masteryOutcomes: Student demonstrates understanding and can successfully complete the required skills for this challenge.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Buggy temperature converter
masteryOutcomes: Read Python tracebacks from a broken temperature converter and use them to locate and fix different types of errors.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Debugging a quiz app
masteryOutcomes: Analyze tracebacks from a simple quiz program to identify error types, pinpoint failing lines, and verify correct fixes.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Functions i: why, define, and call
masteryOutcomes: Understand how functions reduce repetition and improve reuse.
Understand the structure of Python functions
Define a function with one or two parameters and call it with literals and variables

lessons.title: Functions ii: inside the function
masteryOutcomes: Understand the structure of a function, including its name, parameters, indentation, and return value.
Call functions with arguments correctly and trace how values are passed from the call site to parameters, verifying the flow using print statements.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Story sentence generator
masteryOutcomes: Define and call simple functions with parameters to build reusable sentence generators for a short, customizable story.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Workout planner functions
masteryOutcomes: Create and use functions with one or two parameters to generate personalized workout messages while tracing how data flows into each function.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Functions iii: return vs print and early return
masteryOutcomes: Differentiate printing vs returning values
Use return to pass results and apply early returns.

lessons.title: Scope and local variables
masteryOutcomes: Understand that variables created inside a function exist only within that function’s scope (local).
Explain how local and global scopes differ and identify when each is used.
Demonstrate how data can be passed into functions through parameters instead of relying on global variables.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Tip calculator functions - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Refactor a tip calculator to use functions that return values instead of printing, then reuse those returned results in further calculations.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Tip calculator functions - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Enhance the tip calculator with multiple functions that use early returns and local variables, clearly separating local scope from global data.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Logical operators: and/or/not and short-circuiting
masteryOutcomes: Combine comparisons with and, or, not to form compound conditions.
Show short-circuit behavior by adding prints to the right-hand side expression.

lessons.title: Booleans and comparisons: equality vs identity
masteryOutcomes: Use True/False in expressions and store boolean results in variables.
Differentiate between '==' (value equality) and 'is' (identity equality).

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Cafe order checker
masteryOutcomes: Practice combining comparisons with and/or/not and observe short-circuit behavior while validating simple cafe orders.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Identity vs equality tester
masteryOutcomes: Differentiate clearly between == and is by running comparison experiments and storing boolean results.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: String membership with 'in' in conditions
masteryOutcomes: Test substring membership with 'in' and negate with 'not in'.
Use membership checks inside if/elif branches to drive simple decisions.

lessons.title: Elif and refactoring nested decisions
masteryOutcomes: Refactor a nested if/else into an equivalent if/elif/else chain.
Order conditions to avoid overlaps and unreachable branches.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Music playlist filter
masteryOutcomes: Use string membership with in/not in inside if/elif branches to filter and categorize song titles.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Access control rules
masteryOutcomes: Refactor nested access decisions into a clean if/elif/else chain with well-ordered, non-overlapping conditions.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Decision tables to branching logic
masteryOutcomes: Translate a 3–5 row decision table into clear if/elif/else code.
Verify mutual exclusivity and completeness of the conditions.

lessons.title: For loops and range(): counting iterations
masteryOutcomes: Write for loops with range(stop), range(start, stop), range(start, stop, step)
Accumulate a total across iterations and print the result.
Generate even/odd sequences and countdowns with range.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Shipping fee decision table
masteryOutcomes: Translate a small decision table into mutually exclusive and complete if/elif/else code for shipping fee calculation.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Step counter sequences
masteryOutcomes: Use for loops with range in different forms to generate totals, even/odd sequences, and countdowns.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Meet the while loop
masteryOutcomes: Understand what a while loop is and when it is more suitable than for.
Understand the risk of infinite loops and explain how to prevent them.
Write a while loop to repeat actions until a condition changes.

lessons.title: Loop control: break and continue
masteryOutcomes: Understand when to exit a loop early with break versus letting it complete naturally.
Insert break to exit early on a condition and continue to skip an iteration.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Number guessing game
masteryOutcomes: Write a while loop that repeats user guesses until a condition changes while avoiding infinite loops.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Transaction scanner with breaks
masteryOutcomes: Control loop flow using break and continue to stop early or skip iterations while scanning a list of transactions.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Review: decisions and loops
masteryOutcomes: Review how if/else, loops, and loop control statements work together in programs
Diagnose and fix common logic and looping errors in small code examples

lessons.title: String skills upgrade i: indexing and slicing
masteryOutcomes: Access individual characters in a string using 0-based indexing.
Use slice notation [start:stop] and [start:stop:step] to extract substrings.
Use negative indices to access characters from the end of a string.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Secret Message Decoder
masteryOutcomes: Practice using string indexing and slicing (including negative indices) plus if/else and loops to decode and transform hidden messages.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Username Generator
masteryOutcomes: Apply string slicing, step slices, and decision logic with loops to build and validate simple usernames from user input.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: String skills upgrade ii: common methods
masteryOutcomes: Apply strip, lower, replace, and find
Split text and rejoin with delimiters
Handle whitespace and empty fields

lessons.title: Lists i: creating lists
masteryOutcomes: Create lists with literals and from range()
print length with len().
Explain that lists are mutable and show a visible effect of mutation.
Understand when a list is a better choice than separate variables.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Cafe Order Cleaner
masteryOutcomes: Use string methods (strip, lower, replace, find, split, join) and whitespace handling to clean and normalize messy text orders.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Guest List Organizer
masteryOutcomes: Create and mutate lists while converting a comma-separated string of guests into a clean, structured list with appropriate transformations.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Lists ii: indexing and slicing
masteryOutcomes: Access list elements by index and understand how indexing works.
Modify list elements and create sublists using slicing.
Handle out-of-range errors (IndexError) in list access.

lessons.title: Lists iii: mastering list iteration
masteryOutcomes: Use a for loop with range() and len() to iterate over indices and access list elements by their position.
Use a for loop to iterate directly over the values in a list and perform actions on each element.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Daily Tasks Tracker - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Use list indexing, slicing, and safe access patterns to inspect and modify items in a task list without causing IndexError.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Daily Tasks Tracker - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Iterate over lists by index and by value with for loops to update, filter, and display tasks based on simple conditions.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Lists iv: common methods
masteryOutcomes: Modify a list in place with append, insert, remove, pop, and extend.

lessons.title: Ordering lists: sorted() vs .sort()
masteryOutcomes: Sort a list in place with .sort() and create a sorted copy with sorted().
Use sorted() parameters ('key' and 'reverse') to customize ordering and explain stability.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Book Wishlist Manager - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Practice modifying lists in place with append, insert, remove, pop, and extend to manage a changing wishlist.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Book Wishlist Manager - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Use sort() and sorted() with key and reverse to produce different ordered views of a list while understanding in-place vs copied sorting.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered
